item.title: Delete
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Every game gets influence from any other game in the similar game genre. WoW didn’t make up all of their ideas. I don’t like it when people give WoW too much credit. They didn’t create everything thing in their game(s). People say that Jagex is copying WoW’s combat system, no, many other games have had that for some time now. Other games like Skyrim and Dragon Age use a similar one. I haven’t heard or seen anyone saying they copied WoW.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“yo123, post:3, topic:463065”][quote author=Frell link=topic=566301.msg4119535#msg4119535 date=1349538153]
dungeons and dragons
[/quote]Too broad; D&D influenced practically every RPG. As far as I know, it was the first RPG.

What about this image?

It’s from Ultima 7. I’ve never played the game, but I saw a resemblance when I came across this screenshot.[/quote]looks canny to varrock haha

item.title: Delete
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

Andrew even stated he played D&D growing up, it’s an obvious influence.

I don’t really agree on that on, the only Influence I could possibly see from D&D would be item stats which is a very basic concept in runescape. there is no feel of dungeon crawling with the exception of one or two quests in classic. I suppose you could go the route that some of the NPC’s are generic D&D mobs but you could basically say it could of been influenced from a Tolkien novel just as easily.

Read full topic

Well I find it to be backwards really. Runescape has had an effect on several games
[/quote]Curious to know which games you had in mind. Also, a game like RS does not just happen. Ideas are progressed or incorporated as they pass from author to author; one just has to be familiar with older games. The ambition of this discussion is to find individuals who have these experiences.[/quote]hmm well there is a game thread where I was asking for medieval type games that has several related stuff

item.title: Delete
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:6, topic:463027”][quote author=yo123 link=topic=566301.msg4118557#msg4118557 date=1349394432]

[quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=566301.msg4118192#msg4118192 date=1349339471]However, I always felt that runescape had similarities to Myst.
[/quote]How so?
[/quote]
Back when I first starting playing Runescape the game was very open after tutorial island you had been free to do what you wanted and you had to figure it out yourself just exploring the landscapes. I know its very different now they have guides and such but I always found runescape classic to be like myst because you had to run around exploring to see how the world work. I was one of those players that didn’t use the village or runeHQ and tip.it wasn’t around at the time.[/quote]

Seriously, no tutorials. You know how fucking long it took me to learn how to craft? I had 1 crafting for like 8 months.

Read full topic

[quote=“yo123, post:1, topic:463065”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=566301.msg4118192#msg4118192 date=1349339471]However, I always felt that runescape had similarities to Myst.
[/quote]How so?[/quote]
Back when I first starting playing Runescape the game was very open after tutorial island you had been free to do what you wanted and you had to figure it out yourself just exploring the landscapes. I know its very different now they have guides and such but I always found runescape classic to be like myst because you had to run around exploring to see how the world work. I was one of those players that didn’t use the village or runeHQ and tip.it wasn’t around at the time.

item.title: Delete
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Runescape HAD a very unique feel to it they always USED to provide the midevil feel while allowing technologies to flow throughout the games. However it appears they are taking the RIOT approach now and just throwing whatever content they want regardless if it fits within “Runescape” universe.

However, I always felt that runescape had similarities to Myst.

Read full topic
